review_title: Friendly, supportive community unfortunately beset by financial (mis)management issues
job_title: Early Stage Researcher (PhD Fellow) in Bremen, Bremen
pros: Students and personnel are all really nice. Professors are approachable and supportive.
cons: There seems to be an ever-looming threat of bankruptcy or eventual cessation of operations because of financial (mis)management issues. Former Pres. Windt, however, did her best with the restructuring.

review_title: Too much work for a small pay
pros: A great learning experience, close proximity with professors, and opportunities to work with them.
cons: Workload not equally distributed for the minimum payment we got. Other student jobs paid everyone the same, though not everyone's work complexity or even working hours were the same or truthfully reflected. A limit of 20h/month was ridiculous as many of us exceeded that time which is normal.

pros: Location, flexible schedule, communication with student body

review_title: Good place to do a research
pros: Good working environment. Possibility to work flexibly. A very diverse community.
cons: Not the highest salary. Slow and annoying administrative bureaucracy.

review_title: Great experience for a life time if you find the right major
pros: Jacobs University has a great concept and living in a small community on a small campus with people from all over the world teaches you in many ways, prepares you for a live traveling, abroad or with international contacts and gives you friends for a life time. the amaying professor to student rate helps you in many cases: if you want to go abroad for a semester, with recommendations and internships.
cons: Due to the small size of the university not every major is offered and since the university is only 10 years old many things are still shaping. Jacobs is perfect for a Bachelor education but after the BA there staying for a Master is not the best option because Master students often do not life on campus where the younger bachelor students life. Thus, after your undergrad studies life would change too much at Jacobs to be attractive for many undergrads to stay for their Masters.

review_title: Plenty of opportunities for student assistant jobs
pros: Jacobs University offers students a wide array of student and teaching assistant jobs to choose from.  A plus for prospective students looking to earn a little extra during their studies. Most of the jobs provide flexible working hours.
cons: There is plenty of responsibilities already as a full time student. Adding a student assistant job requires exceptional time management if keeping up with a academics is also a priority.

review_title: Good, but a bit overwhelmed by the myriad of activities and shortages of staff.
pros: An international university with a very diversificated culture. Nice, education students and professors. Very good standard of living, a lot of possibilities offered.
cons: Very big problems as far as the "running" of the institution is related. Conflicts at the level of presidentship. Young university, financial problems, thus an unsecure long term future.

review_title: Teaching Assistant for Computer Science courses
pros:
- Flexible work hours
- Creativity is well appreciated
- Salary is acceptable, comparable to other student-jobs
- Easy to obtain
cons:
- One can get way too much work and/or responsabilities
- Little money in comparison to other jobs, outside the campus, that require English language

pros:
- Flexible to student schedules
- Space for creativity

review_title: The world at your finger tips!
pros: I love the international environment of the university! You get to meet people from all over the world and work together with them. What happens afterwards is just magical! If only the real world worked so well in harmony ...
cons: There are no cons. This place is the place to be!

pros: The Krupp College Office (KCO) provides its Student Assistants with extensive experience in time compartmentalization, event management, social media skills, and intercultural competence.
cons: KCO can sometimes get overwhelming, but it is good cause for adaptation to a dynamic workplace.

pros: The place of learning advance knowledge and opportunity to become competent for future work. It is also international and multi-culture.
cons: Majority of the students speaks english, so it is hard to get a chance to practice German speaking.
